did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Writings and miscellany, relating to Russian military activities during World War I and the Russian Civil War. Includes memoirs of S. I. Ver.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mstislav Nikolaevich Ivanitskii Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: Originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Ivanitskii collection contains materials relating primarily to the Russian Civil War in the Far East and émigré military writings. Of particular interest are the memoirs of S. I. Ver relating to his experiences in the First World War, entitled "Iz vospominanii o voine."

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Other Index Terms Related to this Collection

scopecontent.p: Writings (memoirs and articles), arranged chronologically by title
Bulletins, order and clipping, arranged alphabetically by heading
Typescript and printed copy of portion of memoirs published in Viestnik O-va russkikh veteranov Velikoi voiny

did.unittitle: Review of Russkie v Kalifornii, 1935 October 20.

scopecontent.p: Typescript and holograph. Series of brief writings relating to Russian mobilization and military concepts in the First World War

did.unittitle: "Nabrosok (1933 g.): K voprosu o vossozdanii Russkoi Armii," 1945 September.
Subject file. Soviet Union. Raboche-krestianskaia krasnaia armiia--Biography.

scopecontent.p: Brief dossiers on Soviet generals, with some information provided by émigré officers who knew them personally before 1917

did.unittitle: Russia (Territory under White armies, 1918-1920) Voennyi flot.

scopecontent.p: Includes issues of bulletin of the Siberian flotilla entitled Russkii listok (1923), as well as a biographical article on the commander of the flotilla, Admiral G. K. Stark, and a draft of his final order disbanding the flotilla (24 May 1923)
Clipping from the Vladivostok Daily News (15 October 1921) describing his trial
